assertions.title: Benchmark-grade exclusions maintain performance
assertions.statement: Large public asset owners such as NBIM maintain benchmark-like performance after conduct-based exclusions by rebalancing and controlling factor exposures.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Tracking error can be budgeted and controlled
assertions.statement: Index providers (MSCI, FTSE Russell) document exclusion methodologies that explicitly budget tracking error and maintain target factor exposures.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Modern fiduciary guidance recognizes ESG materiality
assertions.statement: UN PRI and US DOL guidance clarify that material ESG factors and client objectives can be incorporated without abandoning prudent, return-seeking management.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Corporate pensions operate under ERISA fiduciary standards
assertions.statement: Corporate defined-benefit plans are governed by ERISA, requiring fiduciaries to act solely in participants' interests and document prudent investment processes.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Public pensions balance fiduciary duty with public accountability
assertions.statement: State and local retirement systems are governed by fiduciary boards that operate under open-meeting, disclosure, and beneficiary-focused standards.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Endowments target 4-5% spending to preserve purchasing power
assertions.statement: University and foundation endowments typically adopt spending policies near 4-5% to balance mission support with intergenerational equity.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Private foundations must distribute at least 5% annually
assertions.statement: U.S. private foundations are required to distribute a minimum of 5% of average asset value each year toward charitable purposes.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Insurers invest with liability-matching and capital rules
assertions.statement: Insurance portfolios are managed to match expected policy liabilities and satisfy NAIC risk-based capital requirements, limiting allocation flexibility.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Central banks defend policy independence and balance sheet integrity
assertions.statement: Modern central banks manage reserves with mandates that emphasize monetary policy independence, balance sheet risk controls, and political neutrality.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Sovereign wealth funds follow mandate-specific investment frameworks
assertions.statement: Sovereign wealth funds operate under stabilization, savings, or development mandates with governance expectations codified by the Santiago Principles.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Municipal investment policies prioritize safety, liquidity, and transparency
assertions.statement: Government treasuries and cash pools follow GFOA best practices emphasizing safety, liquidity, diversification, and documented exceptions for public accountability.
assertions.author: ethical-capital

assertions.title: Household investors balance risk capacity, liquidity, and values
assertions.statement: Individual investors are encouraged to keep emergency reserves, align retirement accounts with stated goals, and use screened products where available without exceeding risk tolerance.
assertions.author: ethical-capital
